View of Palazzio Vecchio, Loggia, and Pizza on Occation of Fête in homage to St. John the Baptist, Plate 23 from "Scelta di XXIV Vedute delle principali contrade, piazze, chiese, e palazzi della Città di Firenze"

label: Description
value: View of the Piazza, with the Loggia at center, and Palazzo Vecchio, left. Spectators in stand, right, and in foreground, observe parade of troops in the square. Title in margin below: "VEDUTA DEL PALAZZO VECCHIO DEL G. D. DELLA LOGGIA, E DELLA PIAZZA CON LA FESTA DEGLI OMAGGI NELLA SOLENNITÀ DI S. GIO. BATISTA PROTETTORA DELLA CITTÀ." At lower right: "Carol Gregorj Sculp. Flor."; at lower left: "Joseph Zocchi delin."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. Arnold W.  Brunner, New York, NY; 1919: acquired by Museum
View of the Northeastern Quarter of Florence, North of the Arno, Plate 3 from "Scelta di XXIV Vedute delle principali contrade, piazze, chiese, e palazzi della Città di Firenze"

label: Description
value: Shown from a point somewhat south of the torre della Zecca vecchia. Bottom margin: "Jos. Zocchi del." "Veduta di una parte di Firenze presa fuori della Porta alla Croce presso al Fiume Arno." "Carolus Gregori sculp. Firenze." "T.III."

label: Provenance
value: Mr. Arnold W.  Brunner, New York, NY; 1919: acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Shown from a point southeast of Porta S. Niccolò. Bottom margin: "Io. Zocchi delin. Et sculp. Figure[as]." / "Veduta di una parte di Firenze presa fuori della Porta a S. Niccolò presso al Fiume Arno" "B. Sgrilli sculp." "T.IV."

value: Mrs. Henry Tobin Maury; 1919; Acquired by Museum

label: Description
value: Floral pattern in blue, pink, purple and white on a light brown ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: roller printed, glazed

label: Description
value: Ivy pattern in green on tan background with stippling. Glaze about worn off. Printed from engraved roller.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Description
value: Bunches of roses and other flowers in red, tan, and black on light background with stippling. Color in leaves has faded out. Probably had glaze but it is now worn off.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Description
value: Flowers and leaves on undulating stems in multicolor on a tan background. Original glaze nearly worn off.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave, glazed

label: Description
value: Ivy pattern similar to 1919-4-2 except that this (1919-4-6) has tendrils. Printed in green on tan background wiht stippling. Except in a few places the green has now faded out to blue.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: printed by engraved roller on plain weave

label: Description
value: Pattern of moss roses printed in blue on neutral background with stripes and stippling

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: relief printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Man's coat, striped black silk cut velvet on silk compound fancy cloth background; collar, cuffs, front and back openings embroidered in floral pattern with polychrome silk; lace (not old) at cuffs; cream-colored satin lining (not original); original satin lining in pockets; embroidery worn.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: cut supplementary warp pile (velvet) on compound ground with embroidery; satin lining
Dish, from the Service des Officiers at Château de Bizy

label: Description
value: Horizontal band probably used originally as lower border of a poncho. Black wool looped fringe sewed on lower edge. Band of conventionalized bird design, running in diagonals in rose, yellow, brown wools and white cotton wefts. Warps of brown cotton. Wefts used several at a time and floated out on back of fabric for width of diagonal. One section on fringe missing.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique (2 sections): 1. complementary wefts; one continuous and one discontinuous; weft floats to pattern 2a. weft-faced plain weave, warp single; 2b. weft-faced plain weave, warp double Sides: one intact Ends: warp loops at both ends; weft-looped fringe attached

label: Description
value: Corner fragment. Brown cotton plain cloth with corner in figured weave. Pyramidal outline in red, tan (two shades). Center filled with minute bird repeat in tan wool and white cotton. Wefts occasionally link with wefts in border. Colors now so faded that design is almost indistinguishable.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, wool Technique: Slit tapestry and fancy compound cloth. A. warp-faced plain weave; B. tapestry on grouped warps, tapestry occasionally single-interlocked, C. complementary wefts in plain weave with inner warps Sides: intact Bottom: tubular warp selvage

label: Description
value: Spindle with slender wooden shaft tapered to ends. One end broken. Other end split with yarn caught through it. Cylindrical black pottery whorl in center, incised and painted red and white. Traces of black, red and white paint on shaft. Small amount of brown cotton yarn on shaft.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wood shaft, ceramic whorl, paint, cotton yarn
